fields.description:
*Assessment*

If a user creates an ELB, deletes it, then recreates an ELB with the same name, the following error appears:

{code}
# eulb-create-lb karate-chop-lb --listener "lb-port=80, protocol=http, instance-port=8888, instance-protocol=http" --listener "lb-port=443, protocol=https, instance-port=8888, instance-protocol=http, cert-id=arn:aws:iam::325271821652:server-certificate/karate-chop-dev-eucalyptus" --availability-zone Honest --region account2-user11@
eulb-create-lb: error (InternalFailure): Failed to create the loadbalancer: could not execute statement
{code}

From the looks of the error in cloud-error.log file, it seems that the security group created with the load balancer already exists, therefore its not being recreated.

Looking at the security group, it still exists:

{code}
GROUP	sg-bf456617	094999295155	euca-internal-325271821652-karate-lb-chop	group for loadbalancer karate-lb-chop
PERMISSION	094999295155	euca-internal-325271821652-karate-lb-chop	ALLOWS	tcp	443	443	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
PERMISSION	094999295155	euca-internal-325271821652-karate-lb-chop	ALLOWS	tcp	80	80	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
TAG	security-group	sg-bf456617	Name	loadbalancer-resources
{code}

I noticed when I deleted the ELB, then immediately created it with the same name, initially I got back a resource error - which was accurate.  However, once I deleted a couple of instances, then tried to recreate the ELB, I kept getting the error above.

*Signs*

Looking at the cloud-error.log file, the following is seen:
 _(small part of the stack trace)_
{code}
....
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "uk_pwp617xjwrerrbquhen87jd7c"
  Detail: Key (metadata_unique_name)=(loadbalancer-sgroup-325271821652-karate-chop-lb-094999295155-euca-internal-325271821652-karate-chop-lb) already exists.
...
{code}

_(Full stack trace)_
{code}

{code}

*Workaround*

Only way to not have this error show up was to launch an ELB with a different name:

{code}
# eulb-create-lb karate-lb-chop --listener "lb-port=80, protocol=http, instance-port=8888, instance-protocol=http" --listener "lb-port=443, protocol=https, instance-port=8888, instance-protocol=http, cert-id=arn:aws:iam::325271821652:server-certificate/karate-chop-dev-eucalyptus" --availability-zone Honest --region account2-user11@
DNS_NAME	karate-lb-chop-325271821652.eulb.future.euca-hasp.cs.prc.eucalyptus-systems.com
{code}

*Steps*

#  Set up Eucalyptus 4.0.2 Cloud with Eucalyptus DNS and Load Balancer enabled
#  Create an ELB
{code}
# eulb-create-lb karate-chop-lb --listener "lb-port=80, protocol=http, instance-port=8888, instance-protocol=http" --listener "lb-port=443, protocol=https, instance-port=8888, instance-protocol=http, cert-id=arn:aws:iam::325271821652:server-certificate/karate-chop-dev-eucalyptus" --availability-zone Honest --region account2-user11@
{code}
# After it has been created successfully, delete the ELB:
{code}
# eulb-delete-lb karate-chop-lb --region account2-user11@
{code}
# After running 'eulb-delete-lb', IMMEDIATELY re-create it using the same name; observe the error:
{code}
 # eulb-create-lb karate-chop-lb --listener "lb-port=80, protocol=http, instance-port=8888, instance-protocol=http" --listener "lb-port=443, protocol=https, instance-port=8888, instance-protocol=http, cert-id=arn:aws:iam::325271821652:server-certificate/karate-chop-dev-eucalyptus" --availability-zone Honest --region account2-user11@
eulb-create-lb: error (InternalFailure): Failed to create the loadbalancer: could not execute statement
{code}
fields.summary: Re-creating an ELB with the same name fails with 'InternalFailure' error
fields.environment:
* non-HA, single-cluster, Eucalyptus DNS, Eucalyptus LB and CloudFormation Enabled
* 1 x CLC, UFS
* 1 x UFS
* 1 x UFS, Walrus
* 1 x CC, SC (DAS)
* 1 x NC

comments.body: Eventually the ELB with the same name can be created. It takes about 1 minutes until the security group is deleted and the constraint is lifted. We should provide the better error message.
To test, delete an LB and create another one with the same name quickly. Check the service returns proper error message.

Tested and confirmed that LB is deleted, it just takes a minute. 

# eulb-create-lb -z one -l "lb-port=80, protocol=HTTP, instance-port=80, instance-protocol=HTTP" jkeuca
DNS_NAME        jkeuca-000029115567.lb.h-01.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com

# eulb-describe-lbs
LOAD_BALANCER   jkeuca  jkeuca-000029115567.lb.h-01.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com   2015-06-05T00:41:48.837Z internet-facing

# eulb-delete-lb jkeuca 
#

[immediate]

# eulb-create-lb -z one -l "lb-port=80, protocol=HTTP, instance-port=80, instance-protocol=HTTP" jkeuca
eulb-create-lb: error (InternalFailure): Failed to create the loadbalancer: Error while persisting security group

[snippet from cloud-error.log]

Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "uk_pwp617xjwrerrbquhen87jd7c"
  Detail: Key (metadata_unique_name)=(loadbalancer-sgroup-000029115567-jkeuca-000769318802-euca-internal-000029115567-jkeuca) already exists.

[after a minute]

# eulb-delete-lb jkeuca 
#

# eulb-describe-lbs
#

I believe this is working as intended. If it needs to be immediate, perhaps the way to go would be to make the error more verbose in that regard, ie:

"Cannot create new LB with the same name during deletion of the old" or some such

The fix includes this in the error message:
"Cleaning up the previous ELB with the same name. Retry in a few minutes."

[~spark],

A couple of questions here:

# Should [~jkennedy] have seen the error message "Cleaning up the previous ELB with the same name. Retry in a few minutes." in the fix you provided?
# Does the cloud user have to delete the load balancer once they see that message before trying to create a new one with the same name?

[~hspencer]
1. Yes
2. No. After they delete an LB and try to create another LB with the same name within a minute will see the message and the creation will fail.

[~spark],  thanks so much for clearing that up.  [~jkennedy], can you confirm this behavior mentioned in your test?  From the results of your past test, it looks like this wasn't the case.  Additionally, would you mind mentioning which version of Eucalyptus 4.2 you tested?  This can be found by the release version mentioned in the output of {{yum list eucalyptus}} on a given Eucalyptus component.

To be clear, based upon [~spark]'s comments in this ticket, the test should be:
# To test, delete an LB and create another one with the same name quickly. Check the service returns proper error message.
# After receiving the message, wait a minute, then try to re-create the LB with the same name.  This should succeed.

[~hspencer] / [~spark] - 

The test was run on the following cloud specs: 

Installed Packages
eucalyptus.x86_64                                                                            4.2.0-0.0.23352.476.20150527git63d27a6.el6                                                                            @eucalyptus-release

I didn't actually see the fixed script in my error, only the error noted above. Am I running too early a release?
[~jkennedy] Yes that release contains commits up to 05/27 and the bug was fixed in 06/01 (6f50e5571f45f783da7d864b3dec26d23ab23a0f).

Fix confirmed. 

Installed Packages
eucalyptus.x86_64                                                                            4.2.0-0.0.23482.498.20150605git5d9a33d.el6                                                                            @eucalyptus-release

#eulb-create-lb -z one -l "lb-port=80, protocol=HTTP, instance-port=80, instance-protocol=HTTP" jkeuca
DNS_NAME        jkeuca-000029115567.lb.h-01.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com

#eulb-describe-lbs
LOAD_BALANCER   jkeuca  jkeuca-000029115567.lb.h-01.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com   2015-06-05T23:24:44.949Z        internet-facing

#eulb-delete-lb jkeuca 

#eulb-create-lb -z one -l "lb-port=80, protocol=HTTP, instance-port=80, instance-protocol=HTTP" jkeuca
eulb-create-lb: error (InternalFailure): Cleaning up the previous ELB with the same name. Retry in a few minutes.

#eulb-create-lb -z one -l "lb-port=80, protocol=HTTP, instance-port=80, instance-protocol=HTTP" jkeuca
DNS_NAME        jkeuca-000029115567.lb.h-01.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com

worklogs.comment:
I believe this is working as intended. If it needs to be immediate, perhaps the way to go would be to make the error more verbose in that regard, ie:

"Cannot create new LB with the same name during deletion of the old" or some such
